creator: wdixon@crd.ge.com
text:
You cannot add a custom tag taking an object and specify
the value as a string const in the jsp page;

You can say:
<dtg:Foo value="<%=new Object()%>"/>  

but you cannot say

<dtg:Foo value="some string"/>

you end up with the following exception:

Unable to convert a String to java.lang.Object for attribute value


Which really makes no sense.  There is no conversion, the String
object should simply be passed to the set method.

Converting the String to an Object isn't one of the promised conversions
in the JSP 1.1 spec, so isn't present in Tomcat 3.x by design.  See section
2.13.2 for setProperty.  The JSP 1.1 errata states that the same conversions
apply to custom tag attributes.

However, this conversion is defined in section JSP.2.13.2.3 in the JSP 1.2 spec
as: "As if new String(string-literal)", which I think is what you are looking
for.  Therefore, this functionality is available in Tomcat 4.x.
